action.content:
You are playing a text adventure game. I will describe what you can perceive in the game. You write the single action you want to take in the game starting with >. Only reply with an action.
For example:
> open cupboard

You can have up to two objects in your inventory at the same time.

Your goal for this game is: Put the potted plant in the cupboard, the orange on the table and the book on the shelf.

Once you have achieved your goal, write "> done" to end the game.

You are in a pantry now. There are a freezer and a refrigerator. The freezer is closed. The refrigerator is closed. There is a passage to a kitchen here.
I don't know what you mean.
I don't know what 'through passage' means.
You are in a kitchen now. There are a plate, a counter and a cupboard. The plate is on the counter. The cupboard is closed. There are passages to a pantry and a living room here.
The cupboard is now open. The cupboard is empty.
You put the plate in the cupboard.
The cupboard is now open. In the cupboard there is a plate.
You take the plate. In your inventory you have a plate.
You put the plate on the counter.

> take book from counter and put it on shelf doesn't make sense as there is no book or shelf, rephrasing: look around 
alternatively, I can see an orange on the counter 
> take orange
